Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the 13th USENIX File and Storage Technologies conference (FASTI 2015)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The USENIX Conference on File and Storage Technologies (FAST) is a leading forum for innovative research in storage systems, bringing together researchers and practitioners from both industry and academia to reveal and discuss leading topics germane to file and storage systems. This award provides funding to assist approximately 20 U.S.-based graduate students to attend the 13th USENIX FAST Conference.

Participation in leading conferences is an extremely important part of the graduate school experience, providing opportunities to interact with more senior researchers and attain exposure to leading-edge work. This award will fund participation of those students who would otherwise be unable to attend FAST, with a particular emphasis upon supporting women and other underrepresented minorities in the field.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Major Goals

This award funded 20 US-based graduate students to attend the 13th USENIX Symposium on File and Storage Technology (FAST), which took place on February 16-19, 2015 in Santa Clara, CA. The support requested in this proposal made possible the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend.  USENIX FAST is a leading forum for innovative research in storage systems, gathering many active researchers and practitioners from both industry and academia. Topics include reliability, performance, mobility, power management, measurement, and other topics germane to cutting edge developments in file and storage systems. Participation in leading conferences is an extremely important part of the graduate school experience, providing the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers and to be exposed to advanced work. Total attendance at FAST ’15 was 523, with 95 students from both US and foreign institutions. 

In addition to attending the conference sessions, students participated in various ways, including: serving as scribes for the conference sessions to write summaries for a later issue of ;login: magazine, attending the welcome get together/evening reception to interact with senior members of the research community specifically interested in meeting students in a casual and informal atmosphere, board game night, the Women in Advanced Computing networking social, and presenting posters and works in progress.

 Intellectual Merits. FAST gathers researchers from across the storage community to foster cross-disciplinary approaches and to address shared research challenges. This collaborative emphasis makes it well-suited for student participation, exposing them to the type of advanced ideas and conversations that should inform their own research and intellectual growth. The opportunity make connections, be published and present their research is invaluable, and plays a significant role in their professional development.

 Broader Impacts. Participation in FAST ‘15 and similar conferences is a valuable and important part of the graduate school experience, providing students with the opportunity to interact with more senior researchers in the field, and exposing them to leading work.  FAST offers many opportunities for students to meet, interact, and exchange ideas, including a welcome reception, the poster session and reception, and small birds-of-a-feather sessions in the evenings, as well as the venerable “hallway track”. This interaction is invaluable to job placement; many companies run booths and mini recruiting drives that help both students and industry compete better. This directly helps the U.S. economy. Many of our student grantees have gone on to become important members of the research community, organizing conferences, starting companies, leading cutting edge R&D projects within companies, as well as running their own research groups.

 USENIX believes in open access to research, and you can view the FAST ’15 student publications on the FAST web site found here:  https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast15/technical-sessions

 The student posters that were presented at FAST ’15 can be viewed in the poster session list here: https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast15/poster-sessions

 The Works in Progress, WiPs, that were presented are listed here: https://www.usenix.org/conference/fast15/work-progress-reports-wips

 USENIX thanks the National Science Foundation for this support.
